page.title: 08Combe Sydenham Hall
page.content: The present house at Combe Sydenham is built in the shape of an E. It was built in 1580 and stands on the ruins of some earlier monastic buildings and there is a connection between these and the other nearby tourist attraction of{Cleeve Abbey. During the{Civil War}the buildings were subject to attack from the soldiers of{Oliver Cromwell. They did considerable damage to the hall. Completely destroying the East Bedroom Wing and three of the four towers. Only the West Wing was re built in 1660 when{King Charles II returned to the throne. The ground floor of the House is open to the public and they are lots of information boards telling the story. Visitors can also explore the {Elizabethan style gardens.
